page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by this survey is both{city and rural.}Situated on the River Wear, the{city of Durham}is the ecclesiastic centre of the region. The cathedral and castle dominate the sky-line and are major{tourist {attractions.}Commissioned by{William {the Conqueror,}work began on the cathedral in 1093. The city is also an{academic centre} and within the survey block there are numerous colleges of Durham University and schools (both state and private). The city region is surrounded by{ {agricultural land and small villages.} The farms tend to concentrate on arable or mixed farming. The villages began as small settlements for{coal {miners}but the mines are now closed and alternative occupations have been sought.
